name: Self/Community in American Culture, 1600-1877 (GT-HI1)
description: Course Description: Critical analysis of the meaning and development of American culture, 1600-1877, through themes of self and community in art, politics, society, and religion.

name: Self/Community in American Culture Since 1877 (GT-HI1)
description: Course Description: Critical analysis of the meaning and development of American culture since 1877, through themes of self and community in art, politics, society, and religion.

name: American Lives-Methods in American Studies
description: Course Description: Methods and changing approaches of American studies since 1950s using autobiography as organizing theme.
column12: Registration Information: Credit not allowed for both AMST 300 and E 300.

name: Seminar in American Studies
description: Course Description: Seminar for seniors in Liberal Arts involving critical reading, writing, research, and discussion.  Topics vary.
column11: Registration Information: Senior standing or written consent of instructor.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Independent Study in American Studies
description: Course Description: Individually-guided studies in interdisciplinary work in American culture.
column11: Registration Information: Written consent of instructor.
